title: Your trash deserves better. These three cases show what’s possible. - Rocky Mountain Institute
summary: Landfills are a major source of methane emissions, but there are many policies and programs that can reduce these emissions while delivering powerful co-benefits. The article highlights success stories from the state of Maryland, the city of Austin, Texas, and Sierra Nevada Brewing Company.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes innovations that contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as decarbonisation, reducing or replacing harmful substances, reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy, nature and wildlife conservation, or the protection of biological systems.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes innovations that are new or improved products or business processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes and that have been introduced on the market or brought into use by the firm.
green_product: TRUE, the article mentions how Sierra Nevada Brewing Company uses much of the compost for agricultural purposes on-site, growing produce, herbs, hops, and barley.
green_process: TRUE, the article mentions that Sierra Nevada Brewing Company anaerobically digests spent yeast. The biogas produced at Sierra Nevada’s North Carolina digester is used in boilers and microturbines, covering about 8 percent of total electricity needs.
likely_naics_codes: ['312120 - Breweries', '325991 - Custom Compounding of Purchased Resins', '561790 - Other Solid Waste Collection', '562212 - Solid Waste Combustors and Incinerators']

title: GT Recycling expands plastic recycling plant - Waste Management Review
summary: GT Recycling has installed a new flexible plastics recycling line that recycles polypropylene and low-density polyethylene into a pellet suitable for use in manufacturing a range of plastic products within Australia. The new extruder is capable of processing more than one tonne per hour and the company plans to wind up to three shifts, five days a week. The new plant will help to reduce the amount of plastic going to landfill and create a more circular economy.
likely_naics_codes: ['326160 - Plastics Products Manufacturing', '325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product Manufacturing', '562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities', '562112 - Solid Waste Collection']

title: Cash for containers program launches - Ocean Grove Voice
summary: Victoria's Container Deposit Scheme (CDS) launched on November 1, with 21 locations across Geelong, the Bellarine and the Surf Coast providing 10 cents per item for eligible containers. The CDS is expected to increase recycling rates and reduce litter in Victoria by up to half. The TOMRA Cleanaway partnership will provide the service delivery in the western third of the state.
likely_naics_codes: ['562211 - Hazardous Waste Collection', '562219 - Other Nonhazardous Waste Collection', '562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services', '562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities']

title: A win-win for communities and the environment - The Age
summary: TOMRA Cleanaway has invested heavily in infrastructure that provides a convenient and accessible network of reverse vending machines for residents across the zone and has created partnerships with several not-for-profit organisations to operate collection points, creating dozens of new jobs.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes innovations that contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing waste, conserving natural resources, and promoting recycling.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a new and improved business process for collecting and recycling containers and bottles that differs significantly from previous business processes.
green_product: TRUE, TOMRA Cleanaway's reverse vending machines recycle cans, bottles and cartons into new products, keeping them out of landfill.
green_process: TRUE, TOMRA Cleanaway's reverse vending machines offer a convenient and accessible way for residents to recycle containers and bottles, promoting recycling and reducing waste.

title: Vic Container Deposit Scheme launches - Waste Management Review
summary: The Victorian Container Deposit Scheme (CDS) has launched, allowing residents to return eligible drink cans, bottles and cartons for a 10-cent refund at refund points across the state. Coles has rolled out 47 Reverse Vending Machines across its Victorian stores, making it easy for customers to recycle and earn rewards. The scheme is expected to significantly reduce litter and give Victorians the option of putting cash back in their pockets.
green_innovation: TRUE, The scheme promotes recycling and reduces litter, contributing to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE, The Reverse Vending Machines use state-of-the-art sorting technology and are very quick and easy to use, representing a new and improved business process.
green_product: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, The scheme promotes the recycling of drink containers, reducing waste and conserving natural resources.
likely_naics_codes: ['445299 - All Other Specialty Food Stores', '322211 - Paperboard Container Manufacturing', '322214 - Plastics Bottle Manufacturing', '322215 - Plastics Bag and Pouch Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not provide any evidence of greenwashing.

title: Top 10 Best Waste Management Companies In India 2024 - Inventiva
summary: India has experienced significant advancements in waste management practices, driven by innovative solutions from leading waste management companies. These companies prioritize waste reduction, resource recovery, clean energy generation, and community involvement. Their efforts contribute to a sustainable and eco-friendly waste management system in India.
